body.p: The cohort search facility allows you to:

li.p: Make cross-patient searches on any entry/element in the information model.
Combine cohorts returned from individual searches.
Save searches and patient cohorts.
Reload searches and cohorts that have been saved previously.
View and print cohort lists.
Export patient data for a cohort.

body.p: To run cohort searches, press the Patient Cohorts button in the main cityEHR navigation panel (available at the top of every page).

image.alt: Running Patient Cohort Searches

body.p: The sections below demonstrate cohort search features using a small test database (e.g., the data generated in the "Generate Test Data" section).

li.p: Navigate to Patient Cohorts in the in the system navigation.
To search for cohorts based on patient demographics, select Demographics (default on page load) from the left-hand search type selection.

image.alt: Searching for Cohorts Using Demographics

li.p: Select to search on Gender, Date of Birth, or Age. Enter search criteria and press the Search button to display a summary of the cohort found.

image.alt: Searching for Patients Using Gender as a Demographic

li.p: View the Cohort Results in the display window.

image.alt: Viewing Cohort Results in the Display Window

li.p: Select the check-box next to the Cohort Search Results.

image.alt: Selecting the Box Next to the Cohort Search Results

li.p: Navigate to the Cohort tab (next to the Search tab). You can now view the patients in this cohort (see figure below).

image.alt: Viewing Patients in Selected Cohort

li.p: You can now print or export this list. Refer to further sections for printing instructions and exporting data.
Select Administration from the left-hand search selection menu to search for cohorts based on the effective time or author of specific compositions.

image.alt: Searching for Cohorts Using Administration

li.p: The cohort is formed as patients who have any compositions of the specified type with the author or effective time as constrained by the search criteria. If no context is chosen then the cohort is formed based on any composition e.g. find all patients with any compositions committed by a specific author (user). Select the search criteria to be author and select any option from the context drop-down (see figure below).

image.alt: Searching for Cohorts Using “Author” as Search Criteria

li.p: Click the Search button (magnifying glass) to return results.

image.alt: Search Results for Co-morbidity History

li.p: Select the check-box next to the Patient List.

image.alt: Clicking on Empty Box of New Patient List

li.p: Navigate to the Cohort tab to view a list of patients from your search results.
Set the search term to Observation. Adjust the parameters to refine your cohort searches for specific observations. Ensure you click Search to display the results.

image.alt: Changing Cohort Search Term to Observation

li.p: In this example, the Observation is set to "Fracture," with time set to Current and Scope set to All Data. Review the search results, as shown in the figure below.

image.alt: Cohort Search Results for “Observation” as Fracture

li.p: If no results are returned for the observation, modify the search parameters to explore different results.

section.title: Combining Cohorts
section.p: The cohort search functionality enables you to combine multiple searches. Follow the steps below to learn how to combine cohorts:

li.p: Conduct the individual cohort searches you wish to combine. For example, searches for Gender equal to Female and Gender equal to Male, as shown in the figure below.

image.alt: Two Cohort Searches (Female and Male Demographics) for Combining

li.p: Select the cohorts to be combined by checking their respective boxes.

image.alt: Selecting Cohorts to Combine

li.p: From the Select Search Type menu, choose Combine Selected Cohorts, select an operator, and click Search. You may also select Combine Cohorts. Available operators include:
AND: Returns members common to both cohorts.
OR: Returns all members from both cohorts.
A PERCENTAGE OF: Finds members of cohort A that are also in cohort B and calculates the percentage.

image.alt: Choosing an Operator to Combine Cohorts

li.p: View the combined results in the display window, select them, and save the cohort search for future use.

image.alt: Combined Cohort Results

li.p: Navigate to the Cohort tab to view the combined cohort list. To print this list, click the printer icon in the top-right corner.

image.alt: Printing Combined Cohort Results List

section.p: Follow these steps to print cohort lists:

li.p: Select the cohort list(s) you want to print from the search results.

image.alt: Selecting the Cohort List(s) for Printing

li.p: Navigate to the Cohort tab and click the print icon.

image.alt: Printing the Selected Cohort List(s)

li.p: Choose Open File and select the application to open the cohort list.

image.alt: Opening Cohort Lists in Desired Application

li.p: Print the cohort list from the selected application.

image.alt: Confirmation of the Cohort List(s) Print
